snippet: Even though there are more Democratic than Republican state senators in New York, a spate of indictments makes Democratic control seem unlikely soon.
abstract: Seemingly unending string of indictments of New York State Senate Democrats is making it more difficult for party to win control of the legislative chamber, which it does not lead despite having a numerical majority; latest scandal, arrest of Sen John L Sampson for embezzlement and other crimes, appears like to provide additional ammunition to Republicans.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and JESSE McKINLEY

lead_paragraph: Even though there are more Democratic than Republican state senators in New York, a spate of indictments makes Democratic control seem unlikely soon.

headline.seo: Sampson’s Arrest Further Hurts Albany Democrats
headline.main: For Democrats, Corruption Arrest Is One More Barrier to Control of the State Senate
headline.print_headline: For Democrats, Corruption Arrest Is One More Barrier to Control of the State Senate
